PFSA

Class PFSASimulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • FSA.Simulator
      • PFSA.PFSASimulator

  • public class PFSASimulator
extends Simulator
    Extends the Simulator by changing the notion of validity of a transition, also handling fresh names. Overrides various methods
    Author:
    Davide Basile

      Change the automaton

      Create a new Continuation with the freezed state of the automaton
      protected boolean isValid(Transition tr, int symbol)
      A transition tr with symbol in input is valid if : sigma=T, stack not empty, top fresh or top equals to symbol in input sigma=i , register i not empty and available, top fresh or top equals to symbol in input sigma=square Z=i, stack and register i not empty, top stack = top register i Z=?
      protected void restoreStateContinuation(Continuation c)
      restore the state of the simulator with the parameters in the continuation C.
      protected boolean sideConditions()

      • sideConditions

        protected boolean sideConditions()

      • isValid

        protected boolean isValid(Transition tr,
              int symbol)
        A transition tr with symbol in input is valid if :
        • sigma=T, stack not empty, top fresh or top equals to symbol in input
        • sigma=i , register i not empty and available, top fresh or top equals to symbol in input
        • sigma=square
        • Z=i, stack and register i not empty, top stack = top register i
        • Z=?, stack not empty
        • Z=square
        • zeta=i, register i not empty, top register i available
        • zeta=square
          • delta=-i
          • delta=+i
          • delta=square
        Overrides:
        isValid in class Simulator
        Parameters:
        tr - transition to be performed
        symbol - symbol in input
        Returns:
        true if the transition is valid

      • updateState

        protected void updateState(Transition t,
               int symbol)
        Update the state of the simulator by performing the transition tr
        Overrides:
        updateState in class Simulator
        Parameters:
        t - the transition to be performed
        symbol - the symbol in input

      • restoreStateContinuation

        protected void restoreStateContinuation(Continuation c)
        restore the state of the simulator with the parameters in the continuation C. First invoke the method of the super class and then update the register of the automaton with a copy of the register stored in the continuation.
        Overrides:
        restoreStateContinuation in class Simulator
        Parameters:
        c - the continuation to be restored

      • createContinuation

        protected Continuation createContinuation()
        Create a new Continuation with the freezed state of the automaton
        Overrides:
        createContinuation in class Simulator
        Returns:
        a new Continuation with the actual state of the simulator freezed
